chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel E Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge plus $2572.69 interstate detainer transportation fees plus restitution in the amounts of $316.50 and $463.31 to AR(dob:5/20/86), and restitution processing fees = $4250.90, The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 85  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges(if he is able to exercise), consecutive to any other sentence, no transfer to another county.

--Mr. Santiago is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

The Court orders the Defendant to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today for DNA sample provision.

Consecutive to: any other sentence

[ma] Case called at 9:41 AM 
Defendant Miguel E Santiago appears from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by DA Hall

The Court orders the restitution request sealed as it contains medical information of the victim.
recess: 10:13--reconvene: 10:15am

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by Attorney De La Rosa

On Count #1: The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges(if he is able to exercise), consecutive to any other sentence, no transfer to another county.
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Santiago is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge plus $2572.69 interstate detainer transportation fees plus restitution in the amounts of $316.50 and $463.31 to AR(dob:5/20/86), and restitution processing fees = $4250.90, The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 85  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court orders the Defendant to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office today for DNA sample provision.

Mr Santiago is not eligible to request expungement.
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions given 

recess: 10:35am
w/ criminal case settlement

[ma] Case called at 2:39 PM 
Defendant Miguel E Santiago appears via video conferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears via telephone.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court summarizes that Mr. Santiago is here on a detainer, and has been produced from the State of Conneticut. Defense has made a speedy trial demand, Jury Trials have been suspended until after 5/22/20 due to the Corona Pandemic.

Further the Court notes that It was not granted permission to have an in person hearing. 

ADA Teuber has nothing further to add

Attorney De La Rosa has no objection to proceeding via video/telephone means

The Court finds video and phone appearances to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty De La Rosa indicates that he believes the Court has the authority to extend past 5/11/20 trial date, but to be scheduled prior to 6/24/20; cites 976.05

Upon inquiry of the Court, parties are amendable to extending trial dates until: 6/16/20(FSSC), and Jury Trial(6/22/20)
recess: 2:50pm 

NEXT: (1)FSSC on 6/16/20 at 2:30pm (2)6/22/20 at 8:30am
Hearing on April 22, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:57 PM 
Defendant Miguel E Santiago appears via videoconfercing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. 
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears via telephone.   Brookellen Teuber appears via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.

On Extension of Time Limits for Trial: 
--Atty. De La Rosa and Defendant have no objection to proceeding via telephone/videoconfercing

ADA Teuber argues that either Atty. De La Rosa or Mr. Santiago need to be present in the courtroom, references ADA Hall's 4/13/20 Letter 
recess: 3:03pm--reconvene: 3:06pm[to allow Court to conduct its own investigation, as to whether Mr Santiago can be brought to the courtroom, in person]

The Court adjourns this hearing until 2:30pm tomorrow, pending the Court obtaining permission for an in person appearance. 

recess: 3:08pm 
NEXT: continued hearing on 4/22/20 at 2:30pm (Attorney De La Rosa's appearance MAY be in person)
Set for Hearing. Attorneys shall appear by phone; Defendant by video from the jail.

[ma] Case called at 1:37 PM 
Defendant Miguel E Santiago appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit, parties waive 'one day' to allow the preliminary hearing to be scheduled on 3/10/20.

The Court requires a $10,000 CASH Bond
